page.title: 18Local History, Scoutmoor.
page.content: About 200 metres beyond Waugh's Well the Rossendale Way path passes a mound of stone and red brick, making the site of Fo Edge Farm. "Fo" means "Fall" and Fo Edge Farm was demolished by the North West Water Authority in 1979, having been derelict for some years previously. Thus a famous historical site had fallen and many of the local people we talked to regretted the fact. One keen rambler told us that the sight should have been left, the farm-house restored and and possibly developed to act as a resting place along the Rossendale Way providing light refreshments for the ever increasing number of passers by.
